reviewText:
I don't normally write reviews . . . But when a not so popular game is this great, I just have to.

First off, if you are thinkning about getting this game, DO IT! This is probably the most unique team based multiplayer game I've ever played. From the art and models to the gameplay, this game delivers in a special way.

The game in a nutshell: Crews of four man one of the many different types of airships and battle the enemy airships in a variety of beautiful and detailed maps. Battles can range from 2v2 to 4v4. (4v4 dogfights are epic . . . Trust me. There are also different game modes.) There are three roles as a crewmember to choose from - the pilot, who flies the ship, the gunner, who mans the ship's main weapon, and the engineer who repiars the ship and mans other guns. (Most crews are made up of a pilot, gunner, and two engineers.)

I love absolutely everything about this game. Its loads of fun working with your crew and fellow allies to blow the enemy out of the sky. The different classes, ship types, and weapons keep the game fresh. You can also customize your own character with various outfits (some you unlock, others you can buy.) Ships are also customizable to an extent.

Just a tip: This game is all about the people you play with. If you have a vulgar or terrible crew, then you'll have a bad experience. My adivce would be to join a friendly, talkative clan as soon as possible. Having a nice clan and friends to play with is what really makes this game fun! :)

reviewText:
I've been playing Guns  of Icarus both alone and with friends, and I find it an amazing game. All three classes (Captain, Engineer, and Gunner) are fun to play, there is great weapons' and ships' variety, and as a result each match is normally a completely unique experience. 95% of the times: good fun!

The community for the most part is really well-behaved, which helps, and I lost count of the times in which more experienced players gave me suggestions and tips. Apart from that, when my friends and I manage to fill a whole ship, it's always amazing: we coordinate easily and we become a deadly war machine! :--P

In any case, the built-in voice chat works well, and it helps the captain giving orders (although there are other ways: standard chat, and keyboards commands).

I wish there were more players, so to reduce the time spent in the match lobby, but that's basically the only complain that I have. Super-recommended!!!

reviewText:
-Quick Review-
Guns of Icarus Online is an online multiplayer only game. You can choose between 3 jobs: Engineer, Pilot/Captain, and Gunner. There are a variety of ships you can fly, some that fly fast, and others that have great armor but are slower.

-Detailed breakdown review-
Story: At this time (April 05, 2014) there has been talk of an adventure mode where there is actually a story, but at this time there is no story (If there is, it’s in those manuals that I glanced at and didn’t notice anything, the loading screen sometimes gives an interesting explanation about a map, so I wouldn’t be surprised if there is some type of story background.

Game Play:  There are some excellent guides that explain more details about how to do the various jobs in Guns of Icarus Online, but basically the Pilot/Captain flies the ship, the gunner shoots the guns, and the engineer hits stuff with a hammer (fixes parts of the ship). There is an overlap so often times you see an engineer shooting guns, and a gunner repairing stuff. The Pilot rarely leaves the wheel though.
The game is completely multiplayer, so at times it’s a long wait in a lobby or trying to quickly join existing games. It’s a pain but if you’ve ever wanted to be on an airship with your friends, this is the perfect game for you.

Achievements: Something that I personally like about Guns of Icarus Online is their sense of progression and rewards. Guns of Icarus Online has a lot of achievements, do not expect to get these very fast, the game is meant to take up a lot of time, you can only repair something 150 so fast. Often times you need to play over various sessions and rounds to finally earn achievements.
The value of earning achievements is that you also “level up”. For example, you need to get 5 achievements to get from engineer level 7 to level 8. As you level up the achievements get more difficult, however the challenge is very obtainable if you’re into getting achievements.
Not only do you level up by getting achievements, you also unlock new equipment and dyes that you can use on your avatar so that you don’t look exactly like everyone else playing Guns of Icarus Online. If you’re really into aesthetics you can also pay real-money to purchase exclusive items… but anyone who knows me knows I’d personally never do that.

Price: Guns of Icarus Online currently going for  $14.99, as I commonly say on my reviews, I prefer to wait for a sale before I purchase a game. However I will make an exception for this game. If you are looking for a game that will eat up your free time, this is the game.  (As of today – April 09, 2014 – I have played only 60 hours of the game, but I know that will probably increase to several hundred hours over the next year or so)
So to rephrase my opinion: It’s a good game, $14.99 is too high for myself, but if you’re looking for a time eater this game will do that and its value is fair compared to the amount of time you can spend on it.

Conclusion: Pro’s: The game will eat up free time, if you ever wanted to fly a ship or be part of a crew on a ship this game is excellent, there are many friendly people in the Guns of Icarus Online community, the game is dynamic and very unique compared to many other video games out there.
Con’s: There is no hanging out by yourself, you cannot fly your own ship online and get grindy achievements – you must be with a crew of other people in a game, sometimes you have NPC’s instead but fundamentally you’re always online and unless you have a lot of friends playing with you, chances are you’ll have a rough time. Naturally whenever you’re playing a game with other people, you meet some good, some bad, and some worse. I’ve had to block elitists, little kids thinking their funny, and people who tend to yell over their microphones – you will have that happen to you, the best thing to do is block them and not crew up with them again.

There is a lot to be said about the negative aspects of the game, but there is a lot to be said about the positive too. It’s just important to know what type of gamer you are, and how well you handle sociality… I personally don’t know if I should have gotten this game because I don’t handle being yelled at well. But I’ve made several good friends so I guess I think that’s worth it. :)

reviewText:
If you love everything steampunk and feel like there's something missing in your life - it's probably Guns of Icarus Online.
The most outstanding and unique positive aspects of GOI are:
-Wonderful community for both casual and hardcore gamers alike
-Heavy emphasis on teamplay and communication
-Gameplay based purely on skill and a bit of experience

The main downside of the game is that this wonderful community is relatively small. Although there is always someone playing, there are times of the day when (or time zones in which) games are hard to find. This may either improve or get worse with time though considering the devs strategy I'll assume it'll get better.

reviewText:
This game is one of the most phenominal ones I've ever played. Very complex yet simple at the same time, Guns of Icarus is a teamwork based game in which crew members crew a ship to kill other ships in 2v2 3v3 and 4v4 deathmatches as well as respective KotH and rotating CP modes, thus teamwork spans from the small intership scale to a teamwide scale, making the game both chalenging and enjoyable.

Guns of Icarus has a steep learning curve in order to understand the game mechanics a curve similar to that of CS:GO or any other team based games. Basics are easily covered and managed through the tutorial but more advanced piloting and engineering tactics as well as gunner acuracy takes some time to learn, but take it from a seasoned player when I say the hard work does pay off.

Additionally, Guns of Icarus has one of the greatest comunities on the internet, which is one of the reasons I've stayed here a while. I've met some of my greatest friends through this game as they taught me how to play and become just as good as them.

reviewText: Very cool game that incorporates coop and versus into one gamemode successfully. You join aboard an airship as one of four crew members trying to keep yours ship afloat in the midst of battle whilst gunning away on the enemies. It also has many tactical and strategical components to it as different weapons not only have different ranges and damage values but also excel at destroying the one or the other component.\n\nI'm just going ahead and say it: Guns of Icarus online is basically Faster Than Light multiplayer in a steampunk setting. Okay, there is no boarding or killing the enemy crew but everything else is in: destroying the armor (the shields) to do damage to the hull, destroying components to disable certain abilities of the enemy, i.e. the engines to remove their ability to maneuver.

reviewText:
This is a beautiful gem, especially when it comes to coop-PvP battles. I have no idea why this game doesn't get more attention.

+ Great community
+ Beautiful & detailed airships
+ Really motivating combat mechanics, and a huge feeling of achievement after a battle has been won
+ Teamplay: It's working REALLY well in 90% of the games. A crew of 4 players is easy to manage, and you can have a lot of fun with your team mates.Especially because of the voicechat feature.
+ Amazing sound and music. It's probably the most catching / enchanting music that I ever listened too in a game, and it's dynamic during a match as well.
+ Easy to learn, hard to master (only with team play!)

- The grahics of the enviroment could look better - but as soon as you are in battle you will only focus on the ships anyway, which are looking great.
- Sometimes the matchmaking can take a while. But normally you will have a good chat (and laugh) with the other players that are waiting. (Just recently someone was reading a book, I think it was Henry Miller, and the others comment on the book and/or his reading skills. :P)

Hints when starting:
Get a headset / Use your headset. And DON'T start as a captain.

PS: Since I was a kid I loved the idea of flying ships. Standing on the bow of your ship and scanning the horizon for enemies with your spyglass, while floating through clouds and listening to the wonderful music, knowing that soon the quietness will turn into a mess of flames, detonations and smoke, is definetely something among the best moments that I had in games so far. :D

reviewText: Guns of Icarus online... this is just one of those games that take you away. unfortunately, it can be a wee bit tough to get into for some people, but frankly, it's their own fault for not giving it their heart. every game has its problems and its bugs, but I doubt any game has devs that are so eager to learn what the community wants and how to integrate it into the game. This is a game where you make friends, where you have fun, and where you forge a name for yourself. a few months ago, no-one on GOIO knew the name 'Caylin', but now, I'm a member of the current first place ranked team, with a mild infamy for my uniquely turquoise costumes and my love of firing lava from the hades light cannon ^^. I shortly became a community ambassador for the game after I joined the Gents, and have enjoyed through and through the experiences I've shared with new players and veterans alike. honestly, I can recommend this game to anyone who's willing to let it go and just have fun. talk to people in game, go crazy, brag and boast, yet prepare to learn. every captain, gunner and engineer has something to share, and you will always have something to learn. See you in the skies!

reviewText:
I got this game in a Humble Bundle.

This is an online, team-based steampunk game where 4-prople crews battle it out on flying boats for number of kills or capture points.

As a player, you have 3 characters, each with a different role, and can switch them between matches. Customization includes clothing, hairdos, and a series of items/ammo/boosts classified by roles.
The heart of every ship is the captain, who needs to steer the ship, draw strategy and communicate effectively with the rest of the crew and allied captains. A skilled captain is crucial to success. Their items deal with driving the ship and finding enemies.
Meanwhile, Engineers are the lifeblood that keep the makeshift boats flying. While it's usually the dullest role, it's crucial to avoid early termination. Their objects all deal with repairing the ship, with a bit of buffing.
Finally, Gunners are the easiest path to learning the game. While it's very easy to set on a gun and shoot at enemies, the skill ceiling, range finding and ammo selection make it a more nuanced task.
Incomplete crews get manned by AI, who are slightly competent at their jobs but lack the adaptability of actual players.

While the game has everything it needs, there's a slight lack of map variety and game styles.
It would be awesome to have a scavenger hunt match type (digging into the theme of salvaged relics from wastelands), and a boss-style battle against giant ships manned by foreign potencies.
Weapon and ship balance has been an ongoing stuggle, as minmaxers find overpowered matches, and a few ships with proven effective loadouts are the norm. Still, the game gets frequent updates and rebalances.
The worst part is the small playerbase. Would be awesome if this could get more players to populate the server.

reviewText:
A game that doesn't look or feel like any other game. Cooperation and communication is the key to succeeding - in other words not a game for lone wolves and people just looking for action.


Is this game for you?

The learning curve is a bit steep for new players, which can make gameplay a bit frustrating if you end up with people not knowing what they're doing. My best advice is to use a mic and try to find higher level players to join. Also, make sure you do the tutorial before entering any matches, as you won't be able to work together with your crew mates if you don't understand what needs to be done. A cooperative level 2 player is most times preferable over a level 15 player who doesn't communicate, due to the importance of teamwork. If you do end up on ships with inexperienced players, try to stick it out... I think there are many out there who give up on this game too fast, simply because they don't really get a taste of what it really is. I've heard several people say Oh
date:
so this is what this game is really about" once they get to play with more experienced players.


The gameplay

When you're crewing a ship you'll hopefully get one or several main tasks from your captain. If you want to do a good job you'll want to stick to them
recommended: since the ship will most likely blow up if you don't. I can't stress this enough; It really is crucial that everyone on the ship do what they need to do in order for things to work. Joining (or forming) a clan is also good if you want to meet other cooperative players.\n\nGiven that you're on a ship with a decent crew
hoursPlayed: this game is just brilliant. Cruising along a mountain side with a steampunk airship looking for enemy ships is a great pastime activity
voteText:
and the game has so much to offer once you get hold of the basics.


The bottom line

If you like the concept
helpfulPercent: don't give up on the game too fast. You may just have had bad luck with the crew mates or captains."

votesTotal: true

reviewText:
Devs started begging players to write positive reviews to attract new players (90% discounts don't do the trick, huh?) 3 years after the release. Here it is.

+ Game concept sounds perfect in theory. Four man crew has to cooperate to control a large airship and shoot down other airships? Who wouldn't like
+ Devs however swiftly get you back on the ground, when you realise a concept has to be followed by an actual good bunch of programmers and designers to make a good game
+ Devs ensure you get to see quite a lot of memorable funny moments, when you see how far from reality they are. They are completely unable to see the state of the game and its community.
+ The community is constantly so hyped about every fart that comes out of the devs you'll get on the hype train easily too
+ You get to find a new bug almost every week
+ Every bug you report will be promised to be fixed
+ For every bug that actually gets fixed you get one bug for free
+ Devs are ignoring the game to work on a DLC! YAY!
+ Competitive playerbase is so small you get to know everybody personally within a week or two
+ Noobs go away immediately after getting stomped by better players, so the player base keeps a healthy number of a couple hundred players
+ During the time I've been active in the game and its community (more than a year) we got tons of new content. One map, one gun and quite a load of promises of better tomorrows
+ You never knew what is achievement farming until you tried it in Guns of Icarus
+ You might find new friends here (no joke here, sry)

- It takes quite a while to realise you can take the friends you got here and go play better games together
- The joke Blame Muse (devs)" gets old quite fast

reviewText:
Guns of Icarus Online.

Game-

Wow. This game is truly one of my favorite games. This whole bioshock inf. themed game (as so it seems) really goes good with the whole steam ships fighting. Love the terrian on the maps, great use of the enovirment such as a map were your in the desert and if you go into the dust it messes up your engine and all your other parts because of the dirt and dust getting into all the little parts.

Other players/Crew

This is a VERY heavy depended game which if your crew is not all on the same page then it will show in your proformence.

-Gunner This class is the firepower of your ship. Must be a good shot with cannon's/Galiting guns/Shotguns. He has the powers to change the ammo type, whether is be fire rounds or rounds that will fly fast and hit hard, but have a lot more bullet drop. Use them wisely and you will have a huge lead over your emeny.

-Engi. Besides the pilot this is the most important job on the ship. When your ship on fire or needs a lot of repairs quick and fast the engi will take care of them if they know what they are doing. Your ship can go from good to bad in seconds and your engi needs to be on their feet and aware on whats going on.

-Pilot This is normally the captain of the ship. It doesn't matter if you have the best crew if your pilot is not a good one or at least he knows what their are doing then you are completely screwed.

8.5/10

8.5 because if you get in a game with a bad crew then it just takes out of the game. But there is really no fixing that.

Ways that I would love this if this was a free roam game and you go to a area and PVP and just be able to sail around a huge open world game and buy and sell with other players and do quest. Yes it sounds like I'm talking about a totally different game but that's what I say about making a new one

reviewText:
Guns of icarus is a competetive game with 2 layers of teamwork.

Layer 1.
You and 3 others are in an airship and keeping it up to destroy two others. Basicaly, you are either an engineer, gunner or the pilot. Work togheter to be a good ship.

Layer 2.
Mainly, the game is 2v2 (2 ships vs 2 ships) so not only do you work on your own ship, your ship should be helping the other ship.

Put that on the other team also and you got hell of a competetive game.

It is actually a very very good competetive game in a completely different fashion than the usual strategy or fps. Its both in a way.

It can be quite confusing when starting the game out, not doing anything is worse than bots so Do the tutorials and read or watch guides/gameplay. And you will get the jist.

It is an amazing game to start seriouse on as it complements working togheter very very well.

reviewText:
The game is way, way better than the metascore might suggest. I'm going to assume the low score is there partly because when you start the game aren't too many maps you can choose from, giving an impression of a limited game. As I've understood it, this is only so that you get practice on the easier levels before you go and navigate in the really dangerous ones. Once you reach lvl 4 in any crew role you'll get plenty more and the selection is about as numerous and varied as most FPS games, Killing Floor for example. These include a desert with component damaging dust clouds, a water temple zone, a foggy fjord and an ambush oriented canyon. When I got the game, there were only two play modes, but the devs have been adding new ones like Crazy King. There is also a good variety of ships, guns, and tools to use in different roles as a part of the crew so you'll have a different kind of match to play everytime you get to it.

The graphics are good, the art style beautiful and the gameplay very polished. Starting players will be aware of only a few basic approaches to battle but the more you play the more you start to understand the potential for different tactics, using all of your guns to their full advantage, coordinating with other ships on your team etc. The community is one of the friendliest online gaming communities I've personally interacted with, most everyone is there to enjoy the game. As always, some players will give others a piece of their mind though. Still, as a new player I got good advice from those with more experience and no one was bashing me for making noob mistakes. Newbies are also restricted to play with other relatively new players (you can opt out from this if you wish), so you propably wont be completely decimated even when you're learning the ropes.

The current game is just skirmish mode (different online battle modes) but the developers are looking to release an adventure mode in 2015; imagine an MMO world with airships, factions, trade and quests and you propably have the right general idea. With what they've managed to do so far I do have confidence that the adventure mode will be a good product as well. They already have the ship-to-ship combat nailed down, all they need is to expand the world they have already visioned and you can find info about on their site.

If you've ever thought gliding through the skies on an airship would be awesome, if you enjoy tactical cooperative play, or if you enjoy steampunk aesthetics I can highly recommend this game - I've had some of my most engaging and fun gaming experiences on it. If the themes don't make you feel excited but you like online team based multiplayer games, Guns of Icarus is still a solid choice but you may want to hope for another sale to get it.

reviewText:
This is a really fun teamplay-based game. It's not your usual kind of mmo where the amount you pay will determine how far you can get in the gameworld. Here you purchase the title once, and after that everything depends on your skills and your team's level of cooperation. Item shop items are purely cosmetic stuff, and some of them are given away for free during character progression anyway.

Working together is essential in this game, and one of the aspects that new players don't always understand first, which is why early gameplay can get difficult and full of lost battles. On the other hand, you can be extremely skillful from the start, depending on how fast you are willing to learn the game mechanics. There are many useful guides around, and most high level players will be more than happy to tell you everything you need to know.

It's most fun with microphone, especially if you wanna be a captain, but I know many great players who do very well and enjoy the game without mics. Some people say that you can't succeed in this without real life friends playing with you, but that's not true, most people here play and become friends without ever having met in real life.Yet, I'd recommend building an in-game friend list as soon as you start, adding people you had fun with, as the game gets more and more enjoyable and personal if you fight with familiar folks, and not always with completely new crew members.

Gameplay and fighting system has a great variety and allows for numerous combinations. You can select ships, weapons, tools, maps, and all of these will determine the outcome. Because of that, preparation in lobbies can get long and tiresome sometimes, even boring, if you wanna play fast, but great victories always require great planning and preparation anyway, so consider it a part of gameplay to discuss strategies while you wait for teams to fill up. Don't forget that this is partly a strategy game, even though it offers action as well, and you gotta discuss tactics with your team at one point, and lobbies are the perfect places for that.

Many people complain about the community and its rules being too restrictive, but most rules that the community guidelines include are perfectly normal and basic considerations asking for perfectly normal and basic human behaviour, such as please don't spam and troll the global chat with profanity and/or racist comments because nobody is interested in them". The difference compared to other games is that here the community takes an active part in making sure that these guidelines are not just empty words on the game's website
date: but are actually kept in-game.\n\nAltogether this game is truly exciting

reviewText:
30 minutes of gameplay, so this is a ''first impression'' review.
I love it.
If you're a big fan of pvp type games ranging from strategy to fps's etc, this is definatly worth a shot.
In my experience this is the first game of its type(?)
You board airships and man turrets, pilot the ship or run around repairing ♥♥♥♥.
You can design your own ship, character and advance in the various ''classes.''
As a first impression I give it a 9/10.

;;EDIT
Now I have a few more hours below my belt, my recommendation hasn't changed.
Honestly, this game has grown on me.
This game redefines teamwork in this genre. If your ship has a weak team mate you're basically ♥♥♥♥ed.
It's a lot about communication, talking to your captain/ engineers/ gunners.
So prior to this game I would recommend getting a microphone if you don't already have one.

Also, there is talk of a single player campaign/ missions, which is planned to be released some time in 2015.
Although this is a fairly new game, I haven't come across any serious bugs or glitches.
The UI in the main menu is a tad confusing at first but once you learn to navigate the game there are a lot of cool features to take part it.
Bounties, hunters, clans, costumes, ships, etc.
This game will continue to be a favorite of mine for a long time to come.
10/10

reviewText:
I have played this game for over a year now, and it's amazed me how I keep coming back to it. So here's my over-due review.

This game is heavily based around teamwork; your task each game is to communicate with your crew - that consists of 3 other real people - and other ships on your team to effictively destroy your enemies. There are a range of maps that include beautiful landscapes and post-apocalyptic scenery, where you must navigate and fight. Currently there are 3 game modes: Deathmatch, King of the Hill, and Crazy King. (The last two basically being capture the point). Teams can go as high as 4v4, and as low as 2v2 and each ship holds 4 crew members with a total of 7 different and interesting ships to fly. There are also 3 classes; Pilot, Engineer and Gunner. Each person takes on their role and performs their duties aboard their ship, whether they are the Pilot who has control over the ship and co-ordinates with their allies, or the Engineer who must keep the ship alive and shipshape. Or even a gunner who's speciality is manning the many guns and many ammo types. Either way, teamwork is key in this game.

New players are recommended to play the tutorials which give a basic understanding of how the game mechanics work. But don't fret, you wont be thrown into the deep end as soon as you start playing. There are a host of servers that only Novice players can enter so that new poeple can learn together with other new people and better learn the game. But the help doesn't stop there. This game's community is simply fantastic. Those who are willing to learn are easily taught by the veteran players and even the game's own version of teachers called Community Ambassadors - picked by the Muse team - who love to teach. So if you like to troll and be really rude and obnoxious, this game is not for you. But if you're looking for a fun game with great people, look no further ;)
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Overview This can be one of the best co-op online games you've ever played. The mechanics are fairly simple and easy to learn (but often hard to master, as i will explain). The game is at it's best when you are on a ship with a competent crew which  communicates  (preferably with microphones). This is key to success because it allows proper teamwork. No single pro player can hope to carry a match without a good team.
While this can make the game more engaging and thrilling, it also creates it's greatest weakness: being stuck with incompetant/silent/uncooperative player(s) that jeporadise the ship. There is really little you can do about this.

If you can get past this seemingly unavoidable weakness, then the game can be a hell of alot of fun. There really is something awesome about blasting ships out of the sky or weaving in and out of combat or feeling like your manic wrench wacking is the only thing holding your ship together! With friends it's even better. you feel like your part of a well oiled killing machine!

reviewText: Guns of Icarus Online is the little game that could. Please ignore the Metacritic score; this game has been updated and tweaked and polished and fixed and balanced beyond belief. If you played the original Guns of Icarus (not online), it was, well, pretty terrible. But it was a good proof of concept; even if it was torturous to play, you KNEW it could be epic with just a bit more effort and funding! Enter Guns of Icarus Online: the best team-centered game I've played in years. Sure, Team Fortress 2 might have the word team" in its name

reviewText:
Great game, would highly recommend.

Pros:
Tactical, in-depth gameplay
Heavy focus on teamwork
Generally friendly and helpful community
Fast pace co-operation
Attractive theme and physics
Variety of equipment and gameplay options

Cons:
Solo playing is not recommended unless you can take orders
Relatively small community
Not the best matchmaking

Tips:
Do the tutorials, educate yourself. This will do your whole crew a bug favor
Use voicechat for better communication and co-operation
Trust your captain's orders
Find a good, reliable clan for a better chance of a co-operative, reliable cew.

reviewText: Can I just say, this game is fantastic.  The players have a great sense of humor and, for the most part, are great to be around.  And, when they aren't trying to convince rookies that all crew members should switch over to gunners, they are very helpful.  One of my favorite things about this game is the fact everyone is on a level playing field.  My crew and I have butchered higher level players and yes, we've all been creamed by lower level rookies, but that is what makes this game fun.  The art is lovely, the community is a blast, and the game play is a ton of fun.  Conclusion:  Everyone ought to check this game out.

reviewText:
I recommend this game. Its a great game to play with friends. I do think you can enjoy this game alone though. Its a very team oriented game though, so be prepared to be cooperative. It consists of three main roles, The Captain, The Gunner, And The Engineer.

The Captain is self explanatory, this is the person that is most likly going to be screaming commands at you through the build-in voice chat.

The Gunner is your main offensive, they are the one's that man the guns most of the time. They mainly control the damage that is put out on the enemy.

The Engineer is probably one of the most important roles, this is the person that makes sure the ship doesnt blow up. They are in charge of repairing anything and everything at once.

I have a lot of fun with this game, and I think you could too.

I give this game a 10/10

<3

reviewText: So I got this game. I played it once. I took a break and had food, good food mind you. Then I played it twice. Yet again I took a break. This time I slept. I slept for 9 hours. The alarm clock went off at 9AM but I turned it off. When I finally woke up at 9:04AM I had breakfast. It was a waffle. Some syrup was on it. I forgot to toast it though. The syrup was warm so it made up for it. By this time I was full. I stood up and pushed my chair in. Only enough so I could get up mind you. I washed the plate and my hands, with soap, mind you. It was lemon strawberry coconut soap, what will they think up next? luckily it was only 9:18Am now so I could still get to school before I was hungry again. I drove to school. Then I parked my car. I parked on the 3rd space from the left. Then I realized I forgot my pants. But it was ok because it was a dream. Then I woke up it was actually 9:05AM. Figuring I woudln't be able to make it too school before I was hungry I played the game a thrid time. Then I realized it was lunch. I had a taco. From Taco Bell. I had runs the next day. It ruined my toilet. I went to the doctor for my illness and I got a medicine for it. It tasted worse than baby vomit. baby vomit doesn't tast good. I then played the game a fourth time. This time I stopped and watched the TV. Nothing good was on it. Thats because I dusted though. Normally I have a really cool action figure of the pope on the top right corner. Channel 45 had a marathon of info-mercials which I quite enjoyed.

reviewText:
Recommendation for Guns of Icarus Online.


PROS:
-Game is easy to understand in the beginning.
-Multiplayer is easy and mostly accessible to all players.
-Character Progression is endorsed.
-Easy to navigate UI for the player.

CONS:
-Clans have no reason to be used overall.
-Character Progression is tideous sometimes to upgrade.
-Sense of playing the same thing every game with no changes.


Notes:
-Playing Online with randoms is not as fun as playing with friends.
-You may choose to level up 1 job, but then in-game not be able to be that job as it is already taken.
-Clans are contradictory to the fact there is no easy way to do clanvsclan.



Rating:8.2/10

Overall:

I would recommend Guns Of Icarus Online to players who have a lot of time to level up their character, has a lot of friends on frequently who own the game, and if you straight up like character progression and teamwork.

reviewText: Guns of Icarus combines steampunk themes with airships and firepower. If you are a fan of shooting, flying or machines then you will likely enjoy this game. It's a lobby-based system where you can get into random crews for ships or make your own. Additionally, you can outfit your ships with different weapons which are then used by players are your ship. Everything takes place in first person, actually ON the ship (even driving, it takes skill).\n\nI highly reccomend getting this game especially if it's on sale. It's something that's best played in doses but even more than a year later I'm still coming back to it.

reviewText: Never played a game quite like it. There's a real sense of your personal responsibility as a member of the airship's crew to do as much as you can to keep it afloat and win the match, and it's exhilirating all the while no matter your role, yet a serenely beautiful experience.\nStrategy, tactics, and teamwork are the name of the game here, with personal skill meaning little if you have to pull the weight of the entire crew. Lots of ships and guns to choose from, the placement of guns on every ship customizable, making every team's airship approach the battlefield differently.\nElegantly executed, extremely fun, and completely unique. Makes my boy parts tingle every time I play it.

reviewText:
Fun 7/10
^Very team dependant. One person slacking can ruin it. I have the most fun with real friends. Dont touch it much otherwise. Also, please have a mic.

Graphics 6/10
^Average. Not bad. Not amazing. They get the job done and will probably age nicely.

Controls 10/10
^ With keybindings it is hard to mess up on this. The game does what you tell it to.

Replay Value
6/10
You can play this game forever. That would warrant a 10/10. HOWEVER, the game is not rewarding or rather, you play the same game over and over. Yes, different people make each match special.
But imagine your favorite moba game. Everone has every character unlocked and there are only half as many characters. It is great fun for a while. But eventually, things get repetitive and dare I say boring.

In Game Store
10/10
Not in your face.
Purely cosmetic.
Perfect.

Balance
5/10
While the ships and weapons are balanced players are not. With a smaller community it can be difficult to fly with people of your level.
That goes for within your own ship, and even against other players.
If your engineer does not know what to repair, your gunner has bad aim, or your pilot turns your ship into a sitting target, it does not matter how good you are as an individual.

Normally, this is where matchmaking, and some sort of player skill balance comes into play.
But with a smaller community, this is not exactly the best choice to segregate players.

Matchmaking
5/10
It can be difficult to get into a game.
You can always find games.
But, it can take a while.

Game modes 4/10
Plenty of game modes exist, and are played. I think this almost hurts the game though, because it puts players in a position of wanting to play a certain gamemode, and potentially nobody wants to play that mode. if 300 people are spread out over say 6 game modes(deathmatch,king of hill, crazy king, 2v2-3v3-4v4 etc) Not including different maps.

Thats about 50 people maybe wanting to play with you. Take into consideration about 7 matches in each game mode and you are down to about 7 people trying to do what you are doing. That assumes no1 is afk or goes afk when you are making a match.
To be fair, finding a match isnt always all that difficult. It more often than not requires a higher level of patience.

Overall 5/10
That isnt bad! It is decent, and fun will be had. It is worth a look. It is not your typical game. has its issues, but is solid fun.

With actual friends 8.5/10
Yes, there is a huge advantage to be had when playing with people you know and generally play games with. This is where the game shines. Plan to play with others, either make friends or get your friends to play with you. but fun will be had.

reviewText: Quite the delightful co-op game, between you and three other friends. No role appears greater than the other, and the game is balanced with plenty of options for crewmates to try out: different tools, different ships, and different weapons, including cannons, guns, and flamethrowers. Once you crash, it really feels as if a team effort to charge into the next battle to make up for losses; and once the other ship goes down leaving a trail of black smoke across your deck, it's the most satisfying feeling in the world.\n\nI wish there were more steampunk games that existed out there, and even if you're not much for the lifestyle, the gameplay is solid still immensely enjoyable. It provides an excellent break from all of the first/third person shooters that flood our gaming market today. Your best bet is to grab this game while on sale along with friends if you'd like to try it out, but not 100% sure.

reviewText: This game heavily emphasizes teamwork, and there are almost no shortcuts around that. In the beginning levels of the game, with the straighforward deathmatch game mode, you can easily pilot a pyramidion or goldfish and simply command the AI to gun your targets down with the accuracy only a computer can achieve. However in later games, you may find that running a ghost ship is not your best option, but I digress. This game does nothing but promote co-op play. There is no kicking other players, and that's great. This has created a community of people who are more than happy to help their teammates with any questions they have, since that contributes to their chances of winning. There is no inherent leveling" system that gives anyone a better advantage then the other. Levels in different roles simply show that you know your way around a ship and give people an idea of your overall skill level. Cosmetic awards are lackluster in the beginning

reviewText: A really charming and fantastic game for the cost. The concepts can take people some getting used to, but the game really does offer an experience that most games do not. It has all the downfalls that come with being a competitive game, but the benefits seem ten fold over MOBAs and FPSs in the sense that when you win there is a truly gratifying team experience almost every match. You feel like the captain of a ship, you feel the pressure of being an engineer as the ship begins to burn, and you feel satisfaction in well-timed and placed volleys made at the gunner position. It is one of the few games I've ever played where I didn't think the game was balanced to how people deal damage.

reviewText:
Great steampunk themed game that heavily focuses on teamplay.

The basics are rather simple and easy to get into if you get someone to quickly explain to you all the important stuff, which is easy thanks to the friendly community GoIO has. (Second option is doing the tutorials which are frankly boring, but somewhat neccessary if option one fails.)
Mastering the game is whole other story, that takes thousands and thousands of games. The simple things you learn at the start get more and more complicated. You'll need to improve your aim as a gunner, get the timing spot on as an engineer and finally tactically outwit enemies as a pilot.

In the first few battles you probably won't have any idea what's going on - that's ok, get through it, it's worth it.

The major flaw of this game are its developers. They continue to ruin the game more and more with every patch. They ignore player feedback and base their nonsense balance decisions on statistics without actually playing the game.

reviewText:
The only game in which you and three other players are literally stuck in the same boat.

You can't jump in a match and do ... whatever. That doesn't fly here. This game at a base level requires some degree of coordination. But bring a modicum of sense and attention (and the ability to communicate either through text chat or microphone), and the community will more than happily bring you up to speed.

Some say Guns of Icarus is best played by buying a 4-pack and grabbing three buddies to play with you. That may be, but I wouldn't know, as I almost exclusively joined random matches for my first 800 matches, and had a complete blast doing so.

The game hasn't had any major updates lately, but what's there right now keeps me coming back again and again. Also, keep an eye out for the Alliance PvE DLC.

Another issue would be a relatively low (but stable) population. It seems to settle around 200 players during a weekday evening a couple months after the most recent sale. Check SteamCharts for more info. However, as the player population is mostly concentrated in the Americas and Europe, there might only be some 40 players or so when you decide to give GoI a spin 4AM in the morning. But you'll still be able to find a match, thanks to the existence of AI crewman! That is, as long as you're fine with flying the ship while everyone else on your ship is an AI.

Point is, don't worry about never getting into matches.

On sale or not, Guns of Icarus is quite the steal if it turns out to be your cup of tea. I highly advise those on the fence to watch some Youtube Lets Plays of the game. They'll give you a pretty good idea of what you'll be flying into.

reviewText:
I definitely recommend this game, though it definitely has a learning curve to it, and there are many ins and outs that are to be learned throughout playing, the community is pretty nice, I can't say everyone is perfectly nice, but there is a large portion which are ready and willing to help, and most are plenty willing to offer advice in lobbies and mid-game.

Being a game with plenty of updates that happen every month or so, there are some changes to adjust to and re-balancing, but even when starting out if some things seem impossible to combat, there is usually a way to combat it, which is why it's always nice to ask around for advice and so on.

Other than that, it is a really fun and enjoyable game, especially if you make some friends in the community or get some friends to join in with you, the graphics are amazing(so long you have a PC to power it), and great game mechanics. So try not to be to quickly defeated, and do know that plenty of players do take a bit of time to plan out ship and crew loadouts. Also a great part is that every ship, and class as well as tools are available without requiring DLC or microtransactions. Really the only microtransactions are costmetics(ship and character), which just adds to your ability to make yourself stand out if you wish. Certain cosmetics can be unlocked by leveling each class.

I'll end to say, that with nearing 500 hours and 1200 matches, it's been great so far and going to continue to play.

reviewText:
One of the most teamwork demanding games I have played, with a very active and involved developer team.

Airship combat, from 2v2 to 4v4, 4 players per ship consisting of a mixture of pilots, gunners and engineers, attempting to work together within the ship itself and further teamwork with their allies ships as well. A Multitude of ship designs, guns, ammunitions and crew tools make it possible to play in a vast variety of manners and no two games are ever truly the same.

The graphics aren't best in the buisness but they are still very nice to look at, views across the horizon are especially beautiful. With a steampunk setting there is a familiar aesthetic to it all, with plenty of cosmetic unlocks / purchases providing a variety of character options as well as some ship customization.

As for the bad points, it's one biggest flaw sadly is that the playerbase is so small, as almost all of it's gameplay issues could be solved by simply having a larger pool of players to draw from. The two main complaints players seem to have is that games can take a while to begin (players join a lobby to assemble crews) and that the teams can often be rather uneven, both would be solveable if it had more players for the matchmaker to draw from. It's not it's only issue, but it's the only one that causes problems.

The community at present is very small frequently meeting the same players, and as a result is very friendly, most of the veterans are more than willing to help teach newer players the ropes. For anyone wishing to start I would recommend doing so during a steam sale and/or weekend, as there will be more activity allowing for a novice-only match to fill up and less of a steep curve.

reviewText:
An indie steampunk-themed strategy game with all the fun of guns, airships and teamwork. It cannot be stressed enough that this is a game where you work together as a team to keep the ship afloat and take down the enemy ship or capture the point.

There is a total of 3 roles which is the gunner, engineer and pilot with a total of 4 spots on each ship. Each class specialized in their role and every one of them has a stamina bar that is useful for the specific class which on default is on the Shift key. However, anyone can grab the helm to fly the ship, shoot the guns and fix the ship. So on any emergency like the captain disconnecting or engineer busy with fixing the balloon, the gunner can help steer the ship to safety and give the hull a tap.

It's extremely hard to care for a ship all alone however, especially when starting out so it's best to have 4 people on the ship to divide the work! Don't have any friends or any playing yet? No worries, the game will set you up with random players to work together and even if there is a chance a few of those spots weren't taken the AIs will help substitute those roles with the F1, F2 and F3 button to control them until the end of the match or till someone else decides to join the ship mid game.

The community is always friendly to new players as long as you're willing to listen and communicate. If you're confused don't be afraid to ask, there are community ambassadors who are specifically there to help along and many other players who will also give you advices and tips for the game.

It is highly recommended to finish the tutorial before you begin because even though it is a fairly easy game to pick up, you might not understand the tools which may frustrate not only you but other players in the middle of the match as well. There are multiple ships and guns to choose from so experiment around and accept recommendation unless you can explain why you declined it with the captain. Gunners are not the only class that can shoot guns so don't worry if the captain wants a crew with 3 engineers.

PS. There is voice chat and you may encounter a few drunk and/or high players for some oddly funny reason so have fun and be respectful of others no matter what.

reviewText:
An indie steampunk-themed strategy game with all the fun of guns, airships and teamwork. It cannot be stressed enough that this is a game where you work together as a team to keep the ship afloat and take down the enemy ship or capture the point.

There is a total of 3 roles which is the gunner, engineer and pilot with a total of 4 spots on each ship. Each class specialized in their role and every one of them has a stamina bar that is useful for the specific class which on default is on the Shift key. However, anyone can grab the helm to fly the ship, shoot the guns and fix the ship. So on any emergency like the captain disconnecting or engineer busy with fixing the balloon, the gunner can help steer the ship to safety and give the hull a tap.

It's extremely hard to care for a ship all alone however, especially when starting out so it's best to have 4 people on the ship to divide the work! Don't have any friends or any playing yet? No worries, the game will set you up with random players to work together and even if there is a chance a few of those spots weren't taken the AIs will help substitute those roles with the F1, F2 and F3 button to control them until the end of the match or till someone else decides to join the ship mid game.

The community is always friendly to new players as long as you're willing to listen and communicate. If you're confused don't be afraid to ask, there are community ambassadors who are specifically there to help along and many other players who will also give you advices and tips for the game.

It is highly recommended to finish the tutorial before you begin because even though it is a fairly easy game to pick up, you might not understand the tools which may frustrate not only you but other players in the middle of the match as well. There are multiple ships and guns to choose from so experiment around and accept recommendation unless you can explain why you declined it with the captain. Gunners are not the only class that can shoot guns so don't worry if the captain wants a crew with 3 engineers.

PS. There is voice chat and you may encounter a few drunk and/or high players for some oddly funny reason so have fun and be respectful of others no matter what.

reviewText:
This game is the creme dela creme of originality and fun in the indie compartment. There's nothing even remotely like this game out there. It's a combination of very intense combat, extreme focus on teamwork and with plenty of unlockables to boot.

The only downside I could think of is the steep learning curve and how stressful some roles can be at times. Trying to maintain your ship is exactly like a poor relationship, everything's constantly broken or on fire until you either learn to man up or proceed to the fire exit.

This really is an indie gem. Got the money? You shouldn't even hesitate, I mean just look at the other player reviews.

reviewText:
A Powerful and Immersive Cooperative Experience
Imagine flying your very own Airship the way you want it. Imagine you and your friends cooperating together as a fully-functioning crew doing various tasks (controlling the helm, manning the guns, repairing engines, etc) working together as one to thwart the opposing crew, just like organs in a body working together to achieve an objective. Imagine your adrenaline rush when you are busy fixing the hull of your ship as the enemy closes in starboard side and no one is manning the gun and you enthusiastically called for help while the captain directs someone to repair the balloon due to losing altitude. Imagine working together with 2 other crew teams against 3 opposing teams (12v12) in the midst of a Sandstorm, imagine a game full of adrenaline, tactics and chaos.

That game is Guns of Icarus Online.

If there is any game that tests your cooperation, look no further. The graphics are deeply immersive with various maps and airships, coupled with amazing music that warrants you into the Steampunk Universe. You can choose among 3 roles (Captain, Engineer and Gunner), which gives you added advantage performing specific tasks. As the ship requires someone to steer, gunners to man the gun, engineers to fix ship components in the midst of a battle, everyone will have things to do at all times and you will have to do it in tandem with the other players.

There are currently a total of 7 ships available to choose from (3 for Novice matches), and the fact that each ships has a different layout as well as stats really gives each one a very different feel and a very large-scale of depth for any team albeit anyone to master.

My own experience was a blast as I played this game along with three other RL friends, we have switched various ships and realized how extensive this game was as each of these ships give a very different feel. We found one that works though, and performance really showed when we decided to use this ship. Overall we are playing non-novice matches regularly and each session are always packed with high amounts of adrenaline and gameplay depth.

Negative points
To be fair, there are some quirks and negative points if you really want to pick and prod, here are some minor negative points that we pick up if you are really concerned:
- Open information prior to match is open to abuse where dirty abusive players (or those who want to win no matter what) will customize their loadout to counter yours.
- Player customization is very minimal, but perhaps this is due to their business model.
- In-game description does not really match and is often misleading, to really understand each of the weapons/bullets/ships, it is critical to have a hands-on experience in each of them.

Despite that, overall this game has totally blew our mind as it totally went above and beyond our expectations

TL/DR
This piece of gem has flown under my radar for so long and judging by the fact that none of my friends from various gaming communities has ever mentioned this game is simply ludicrous. This game is an absolute blast! If you have friends (4 as a team), please buy it already.

reviewText:
PROS
- Focus on tactics over twitch reactions
- High customisablity
- Good community
- FUN
- High replayability
- Graphics and Sound are well polished

CONS
- Very addictive
- Menu system needs better explanation for newbies, but not too difficult to get the hang of


Truth be told, this is easily one of the better Multiplayer offerings available on Steam !

For a brief overview, this game is all about team planning and strategy. But where other games focus on twitch reactions and the like, Guns of Icarus is more of a deliberate slow burner. Every move you make is critical, but a quick trigger finger is less important than setting up where you are going next. Once you get in close and all hell breaks loose, it is rare to feel cheated in the event of destruction - it just means you have to regroup and try a new approach. Half the fun is in the endlessly replayable variance of trying to overcome different captains and their new tricks while maneuvering between the canyons, wrecks and sandstorms of the map.

Even before you get into an actual match, there is a huge amount of customisation and planning you can undertake to provide subtle advantages (and disadvantages). Not only do the three classes (Pilot, Engineer, Gunner) each have special 'stamina' abilities dedicated to the left shift key which range from enhanced ship mobility, quicker reloading and faster in person sprinting, but they also have access to extra slots for their respective class items that dictate what they can do. Engineers can choose from various repair tools, Gunners from a variety of ammo types and Pilots can pick from a number of ship-based 'buff' abilities that can help maneuver in times of trouble. This, coupled with the large number of cool airships each with their own unique configurations of customisable weapon placements, gives the entire game an impressive level of tactical feel few others match. Do you go for the long range barrages of a Hwacha-armed Galleon, or hope to outmaneuver it with a zippy flamer-equipped Squid?

The community itself is welcoming and pleasantly receptive to banter - I have had no trouble with anyone, and though not everyone has mics there is a comprehensive set of commands issuable via the 'V' key to cover almost all situations. If you DO get a team full of mics, though, then it turns into a joyful mad cacophany of communication as gunners call out targets out of arc and engineers shout out for help putting out engine fires while the Pilot converses with the other captains calling out battle plans.

All in all, it is definitely worth the money whether you are just looking for a fresh multiplayer experience or you are after something deeper and far more unique than available elsewhere. The 4-pack is a steal, and even more so when it is on sale.

Grab some friends and rule the high skies !

reviewText: Талантливые ребята из студии Muse Games подарившие нам такие шедевры как CreaVures и оригинальную Guns Of Icarus, пошли дальше в чащу своих грязных фантазий и решили добавить к игре приставку online.  Для достижения поставленной цели был создан проект на сайте Kickstarter.com и безумная толпа фанатов брызжа слюной бросилась кидать деньги прямо в монитор. Баснословная сумма в размере $35,237 (из запланированных $10,000) окончательно свела с ума молодых разработчиков, и они пустились во все тяжкие. К разработке подключили все имевшиеся на тот момент ресурсы: кодеин, метилфенидат, ДОБ, ЛСД, героин, гашиш и DVD с концерта Джастина Бибера (образ которого послужил подобием для всех игровых персонажей). Результатом затянувшегося трипа 27 октября 2012 года стала госпитализация всего состава студии, а через пару дней состоялся релиз игры в сервисе Steam. Впечатления от творения Muse Games противоречивые, с одной стороны это крепкий, сильный ♥♥♥♥♥♥ положенный на геймплей, баланс, интерфейс и самого игрока. С другой стороны это совершенно новый игровой опыт и впечатления. В наше время засилья однотипных шутеров, шутеров с элементами рпг, шутеров с элементами головоломок, шутеров с элементами шутера, этот необычный симулятор управления боевыми дирижаблями ЧЕГО ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥? СИМУЛЯТОР УПРАВЛЕНИЯ БОЕВЫМИ ДИРИЖАБЛЯМИ? ВЫ ЧЕГО ТАМ, СОВСЕМ ЕБАНУЛИСЬ? БЛЯЯЯЯЯЯ БОЕВЫЕ ДИРИЖАБЛИ, ЕБАНЫЙ В РОТ СЛУДУЮЩЕЙ НАВЕРНЯКА БУДЕТ СИМУЛЯТОР УПРАВЛЕНИЯ СФИНКТЕРОМ ВО ВРЕМЯ ДЕФЕКАЦИИ ONLINE.\nВсе вышесказанное является авторским вымыслом и неуклюжей попыткой пошутить, играйте в хорошие игры, удачного вам дня!\n

reviewText:
I have been playing guns of icarus now for quite a while together with some old friends and some new ones i found through the game.

Now after about 35h of game time I can without a doubt say the game is one of my most favorite team game I have ever played. With the roles of: Captain, Engineer and Gunner the essential part of the gaming experience is the teamplay. As one team consists of two to three ships (which by the way also have unique roles like tanking damage or sniping) it can be a very challenging game for those of you who want to battle other players with unique tactics and crazy ideas.

If on the other hand you dont want to think about your every move but rather set the enemy on fire or destroy them with a swarm of rockets this game will absolutely rock your day too since you can join a crew as a gunner and blast the enemy to hell with a quite impressive arsenal of weapons (all picked by the captain).

Now if you want to help the captain to keep the ship afloat and help your team by not only repairing the ship but also buffing specific parts to increase performance and allowing the captain to outmanouver the enemy. Then the engineer is a class well suited for you. But dont worry every good gunner knows his way around a gun to help out his gunner colleague.

As a Captain you will have little time to use a gun or repair the ship since you will be busy managing not only your ship but also knowing where and when to strike to fully utilice your crew and ship. As I mainly play this role I can assure you it is not an easy job to do but one worth every second doing it if you successfully flank an enemy, catch them of guard after an well planned manouver or scaring the crap out of them if you burst guns blazing out of a cloud singing a song of doom and destruction.

Now to the technical part:
The game looks nice but is not a graphic festival. The effects like explosions are well done and the textures are well chosen and of good quality. The game runs fine on about any pc (if you have a notebook which is very old you might have laggs inside of clouds or if the enemy is burning you with a flamethrower). The servers run fine and a ping up to 150 is about not noticable which makes finding a server alot easier.

Gameplay:
Well done even though i miss sprinting
The ships fly nicely and i like the time it takes them to react to your command (feels more real this way). Gunplay is good though a bit hard to learn for long ranges since you and your target are mostly moving at a very fast pace.

Balance:
Well balanced weapons even though at the moment the flamethrower seems to be a bit strong since they render weapons unusable fairly quickly (like i said its not like they are overpowered they are just a hinch to strong in my opinion)

Negative:
the AI cant gun for ♥♥♥♥ = you need a lot of people to play the game with the most fun (3-4 people at least) but since the community is pretty nice you almost always find  good team to stay with for a while.
certain ships need each other ( flying a spire(good damage oriented ship) together with another random ship will most likely end badly since the spire needs to be protected and not everybody knows that.

Positive:
Fun game to play with friends. almost everyone finds something he/she wants to do. Pretty difficult at the beginning since you have to learn a lot in action. Nice community. Cool developers who will fight with and against you and are good at the game. A lot of future stuff planned like coop missions and an entire mmorpg world ruled by players . Decent graphics nice gameplay and a lot of thinking to do. Very team oriented gameplay the team with the better teamwork nearly always wins (exceptions will occure with harpoon squids). You have the ability to simply mute annoying players.

column37: and hide around and sandstorms that sneak out out of nowhere.\n\nTo put the gameplay in perspective
column38: think of this: Your ship is charging out of a cloud at the unprotected side of an enemy ship. Gunners man the front guns and open fire while the captain rushes in for a ram. Your ship hits theirs and glances off to the right
column39: while their ship spins around and is facing your right side. The situation is now a scramble
column40: gunners running to the right side guns of the ship and trying not to fall off in the process
column41: mechanic repairing damage to the hull from the ram
column42: and the captain trying to get the ship out of the enemy's range of fire. The enemy ship is now facing guns forward at yours and starts pounding away with a mortars and a flamethrower
column43: disabling your side guns and deflating your balloon. Your ship is slowly falling
column44: the captain has decided to retreat and the whole crew is focused of keeping the hull in repair and the balloon inflated. Despite the crew's efforts
column45: the hull's armor is down and the ship is now taking direct damage. Lucky for you

reviewText: I've had a hard time getting into most online games, but Guns of Icarus Online immediately captivated and addicted me.  I LOVE the teamwork aspect of it -- communicating with your captain/crew, your teammates, and working togeher are vital to your success.  The gameplay is fun and simple on the surface -- easy to learn, but difficult to master.  Once you have the basics down, you can really focus on strategy.  The community is, by and large, extremely welcoming, polite, and friendly.  The world is pretty and the steampunk aesthetic is awesome.  I highly recommend this game to pretty much anyone who likes any kind of game.  There's a reason I've played over 800 matches in less than two months.  xD

reviewText:
Guns of Icarus Online is the best airship combat game out there, in my opinion. It really is a great game. At any given time there are hundreds of people playing the game, and for such a cheap and small title, that's a rather large community of gamers.

Anywhere from 1 on 1 to 3 on 3 airships can battle eachother. There are 4 crew members per airship, up to a total of 24 people in any given game at a time. And better yet, if there aren't enough people, there is AI that will fill in the slots.

So, what's so fun about this game? A bunch of different airships to pilot? A multitude of turrets to man and rain destruction down upon your enemies? Constant havoc being wreaked upon your ship that you need to fix? How about all of the above! With 3 different classes, all capable of performing every single airship task, however each with their own unique sets of equipment and buffs, the Gunner, the Pilot, and the Engineer. This game is a real blast.

Give it a try, and don't knock it until you do. Firefights in the sky among floating balloon-boats. Yeah.

reviewText: As of review [Aug 2013], Skirmish Mode offers a modest selection of airships and character loadouts, but the real strategy is squarely on skill. While the dieselpunk aesthetic might seem just decorative, it does lend itself to a community of gentlemen and madames -- polite, jolly, and brimming with good sportsmanship (most of the time). It is a game about teamwork: one-on-one PvP is absent, and 'leveling up' are for achievements only. You are as good as you can play, and even then, you are only as good as your team and will be expected to communicate clearly while maintaining humour and focus under fire. Commendations await, budding sailors!

reviewText: Despite what the Metascore says, this game is fun to play.  It's a first-person shooter where you and your team fly an airship.  Even though it's a first-person shooter, you don't shoot using rifles and pistols.  The ship has turrents and cannons on it.  The ships look like a pirate ships but is suspended in the air by a giant hot air balloon.  You have a choice of charater classes to play.  You can play as a Captain, Engineer or Gunner.  You can also customize your character.  Each class has a different skill.  Even though you have a certain job"
date: any character can take the helm or a gun.  Someone has to fly the ship as it doesn't fly itself.  Engineers fix broken or damaged parts for the ship.  If your ship becomes too damaged it's harder to defend and eventually it crashes.  After that you respawn.  After so many points
recommended: a team wins.  This game has a nice steampunk theme.  It makes everything look vintage.  To be completely honest
hoursPlayed: it's not a first choice game for first-person battle in my opinion but it has a different setting that most games don't have.  Most battle games take place on a battlefield or buildings.  Flying ships are nice to take the humdrum out of battles.  I recommend playing it!"

reviewText: It's a great game to play and at the perfect price. If you enjoy steampunk ships battling it out in a beautiful open world then you will enjoy this. You work together in a team of up to 4 ships with a crew of 4 per ship. The classes are Gunners, Engineers, and the captain which is of course Navigator. Teamwork is a must in this game as you work together to give the ship life and flight. The devs of the game are nice, helpful, and can also been seen often in the chat when not busy working to improve the game or listenning to feeback. The community has also been very good and you will rarely ever find a troll in my experience. I can also safely say the game is not pay 2 win due to the fact the cashsop is only cosmetics. All you need to do is pick a role or even swap roles, pick a ship and the parts you like, or pick your ammo and head out to earn your fame.

reviewText:
Due to sale Currently going on at the time of this review, i decided to let my opinon be known about Guns of icarus.

GOI online is a Team-based game in which you and your crew battle other airships for supremacy of the skies.

The Major selling point for me is that i have yet to see a game quite like GOI online.Therefore on uniqueness alone i could give it a possible recommend.

The gameplay has variety, with moments ranging from fast-paced heart pumping action to slow tension building moments. Some people have complained that the gameplay can get a little slow and this is true during certain matches. It is not a twitch shooter by any means.

The Graphics:There is no ground-breaking textures to be found in GOI online, While some may  dislike this, i do not mind it at all. I would describe the graphic style as Warm and inviting, Not cutting edge.

The Ships and combat of GOI are where you find the meat of the game.
Each ship feels unique in the way it handles and the way you must fly and move around on it.
There is a noticible difference when you go from piloting a heavy ship to a far lighter vessel.
The weapons also add a lot of depth to this game with many different types of weapons and ammo that have varying effects on how your shots behave in flight.The movement of your ship and the enemies is also a factor

A word of caution to the Rambo's out there. This is a team game to the extreme.Do not expect to be a one man army in GOI. Victory requires the entire crew to communicate,Calling out enemy vessels. Directing the pilot to manuever to give you a shot,Calling out repairs etc.

If team games and Steam punk airships sound good to you i say give this little gem a try.

There is also plans by the devs to add open-world gameplay in the future. I do not know if it will happen anytime soon or ever but there is already plenty of game here for your money.

The description of this game kind of sumps it up better that i could. reviewText:
Guns of Icarus Online... sounds promising, doesn't it? And it pretty much is VERY promising. I mean, I could probably go on and on about how good this game is and how I just adore it, even though I didn't really play that much (seeing as some people have 1k+ hours on this and I have a mere 27+). I'll try to make it as brief of a review as I can but don't blame me if it ends up pretty long (because there's a number of things I wish to describe).
My first thought about this game was 'Oh my, a steampunk game about airships! Now that's a must have!'. I should probably tell you know that I'm a BIG steampunk fan. But back to the topic at hand: when I bought Guns of Icarus Online and actually got into a real game I was stunned. And no it wasn't because it was bad. Two words: airship battles. And not the kind you would expect from a regular multiplayer deathmatch oriented game where you fly a ship and pew pew everything in sight. Instead you get a team effort game. You and three other people are the whole crew of an airship (and you have about seven to choose from). You man the guns, keep the blasted thing alive and shoot other airships. Each member of your glorious crew is of one of the following professions: captain (responsible for flying the ship), engineer (repairs and rebuilds the ship parts) or gunner (your pew pew man). Of course, there some multi-classing aspects and everyone can attend to other jobs (only not so well).
Doesn't sound impressive? Well then, let me assure you that those combats are gloriously dynamic. You run around whacking things with a rubber mallet, shoot things or manoeuvre through the skies, hoping you don't get sandwiched by two Galleons and you can actually FEEL that you're a part of the crew. And it's not that you carry" people to victory. It's completely about the effort of everyone on the ship. I don't know about others but those kind of feels really get to me.
And speaking of airships
date: they are designed so very well. They have this steampunk touch I so love about them. And not only that they look really well they also come in a decent variety. On one side of the list you have a big
recommended: slow airship packed with tons of heavy weaponry. On the other there's a fast
hoursPlayed: mobile ship with no heavy guns (though has an annoying tendency to burn you all the time). Maybe something in between? Though there's only seven ships
voteText: I'm sure most people will find something that suits them (my two personal favourites are the Spire and the Mobula). The only downside I can see here is that some of the ships are the engineer's worst nightmares (ironic that my favourites are those nightmares... and I play the engineer).\nNow let's speed this review up a bit. The graphics are nice. I really like the particles and how the ships look. So that's a plus. And the music is really good. The voice chat is pretty handy and helps a lot. Alas
helpfulPercent: the game has a few flaws. The first one is that it tends to lag from time to time for no big reason (which isn't really that frustrating... I
votesHelpful: for one
votesTotal: don't really mind) so you end up falling off through the floor of your ship or see a teleporting enemy
votesFunny: and the part you were so eagerly smashing with your mallet isn't very responsive. The second one that comes into my minds is that... it's hard to find games and crew. Don't get me wrong

reviewText: As of review [Aug 2013], Skirmish Mode offers a modest selection of airships and character loadouts, but the real strategy is squarely on skill. While the dieselpunk aesthetic might seem just decorative, it does lend itself to a community of gentlemen and madames -- polite, jolly, and brimming with good sportsmanship (most of the time). It is a game about teamwork: one-on-one PvP is absent, and 'leveling up' are for achievements only. You are as good as you can play, and even then, you are only as good as your team and will be expected to communicate clearly while maintaining humour and focus under fire. Commendations await, budding sailors!

reviewText: This game heavily emphasizes teamwork.  In the beginning levels of the game, with the straighforward deathmatch game mode, you can easily learn the ropes of the game.  The leveling system doesn't give anyone an advantage. Levels show that you know what you are doing and give people an idea of your overall skill level.  The game also isn't pay to win.  What you can pay for is cosmetic enhancements.\n\nOverall, GoIO has given me several hours of fun gameplay with my friends.  If you like co-op games based on team skill, then definitely buy this game. The devs put alot of effort into this game.  They even play and give free rewards if you can beat them.  They are still improving this game.  Even now, there groundworks for an adventure mode, based on the wreckages you can see in the battle maps that suggest a cataclysmic war of some kind.

reviewText: This game provides a very unique experience that you won't find in other games. You can't quite describe the feeling - when you know the ship is going down, the captain isn't even at the steering wheel anymore but huddled in a corner wondering when it all went wrong, being razed by fire on both sides, all engines failing and balloon popped, you try and jump ship only to find yourself back on board... you'll have to try it yourself to understand. Gameplay is very balanced, nice variety of ships and guns and regularly updated for new content. The only criticisms I have are some lag/disconnection issues especially on foreign servers, and graphics aren't the greatest. The community is very friendly, and very competitive. Invest in a microphone, if you want to really get into it.
